title: Active Learning-Based Surrogate Model Design for Reliability Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary Statistics, Mathematical Modeling, and Engineering Problem Interpretation Skills
context.additional_context: A Process Exploring Reliability Analysis Methodologies for Complex Engineering Problems Based on Practical Experience. Designing Learning Activities Accessible in Smartphone-Centric Limited Environments

learning_goals: Explain methods to reduce reliability analysis computational costs by over 30% using active learning-based experimental design (DoE)
Achieve over 90% accuracy in reliability evaluations for mathematical/engineering problems by applying the GLM-CM methodology considering kriging model uncertainty
Establish criteria for evaluating accuracy-efficiency balance through combinations of surrogate models and active learning techniques, and apply them to PBL projects

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
